intro: Chisocheton pentandrus subsp. medius, commonly known as the Malayan white sand apple, is a member of the Sapotaceae family and is native to Southeast Asia. It is a small to medium-sized tree characterized by its smooth, pale bark and elliptical leaves with a glossy upper surface. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in panicles, followed by oval, woody fruits containing a single seed. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in lowland dipterocarp forests. The subspecies medius is distinguished by its unique floral and fruit morphology compared to other subspecies of Chisocheton pentandrus.
